text: [Music]
hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to
my cupcake addiction the things that
you're gonna need to make your walking
dead inspired cupcakes I've got
chocolate frosting I'm opting for a
ganache option today I've got some
edible gold dust some little stars
sprinkles of cause cupcakes and I'm
using my chocolate cupcake recipe which
is from the sweet celebrations cookbook
but I'll also leave a link down below
where you can find that recipe on my
blog I've got a piping bag and just a
round piping tip for the hats I'm gonna
use little chocolate Rolo caramel cups
and also Pringles and I'm gonna use a
little bit of fruit roll-up
you'll only need one of these I'll also
leave you a link to the template for
your little Carl and Rick face cupcake
wrappers down below you'll need candy
melts or compound milk or dark chocolate
to make your hats brown let's get
started the first thing you want to do
is add a little bit of that melted candy
melt or milk chocolate onto the bottom
of your Rolo cup and then use that to
kind of join the Rolo cup right in the
center of the Pringle once your Rolo
sets on the Pringle you're gonna take a
little bit more of that melted chocolate
and instead of dipping the whole hat I
found this cause the Pringles to break
you just want to dip one half and then
very gently turn and dip the other half
shake off any excess and then rest it
gently on a piece of parchment once
you've got your hats lined up in a row
you can slice a very thin strip off your
fruit roll-up and grab some of those
star sprinkles so I'm gonna add the star
sprinkles into a small container of my
gold luster dust which is kind of gonna
coat them then I'm also gonna throw in
those little strips of fruit roll-up the
whole lot together is just gonna make
sure we get a nice even coating of gold
across what's gonna be our little straps
and our little stars the little fruit
roll-ups you can just wrap gently around
the tops of those hats and just drape at
the front they should just stay on by
themselves but you might need another
tiny little dab of chocolate on the back
of those stars so you can attach to the
sheriff's star to the front of each of
your hats that is literally how easy
these tiny hats are to make for those
printable templates you just want to
print them on a regular home printer and
if you have craft paper or something a
little more
judi than regular paper to print the
white it helps them to retain shape cut
around them attach them with a little
bit of tape at the back so they fit the
size of your cupcakes and your cupcakes
are ready to ice to make my chocolate
ganache I'm just using milk chocolate
and then also cream you want to
microwave those until they're nice and
runny and smooth and mixed together and
then let them chill for about an hour or
two on the bench you just want to get a
cool temperature around your ganache so
when you put your finger in it feels
slightly colder than your body is take
your electric mixer now and you want to
whip that ganache up to give it that
beautiful light fluffy whipped ganache
effect if you've never made chocolate
ganache before you can check out my
chocolate ganache
threeways video I'll leave a link to
that one down below it'll show you
everything you need to know to get your
ganache to all of the different
consistencies we talked about but today
we're making whipped so whipped ganache
should look like this super light and
fluffy
almost like chocolate mousse kind of
tastes a bit like chocolate mousse
cherry I'm gonna pop mine into a piping
bag I'm gonna use a round open piping
tip but you guys can use a stop or
whatever you like here so these are

a toy story or a sheriff Callie type

is the hair and the Pringle and the

because they're made out of paper they
can have a tendency to absorb the
different fats and oils in the frosting
and then on goes a little Walking Dead
